alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 04 at 3:03AM PST until December 04 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and freezing rain expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, heaviest above 500 feet. Ice accumulation of up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Western Columbia Gorge and South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Snow, ice, and gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty east wind may result in localized blowing snow this morning. Precipitation will likely change to freezing drizzle overnight tonight, so untreated roads may still be icy through Monday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
